Wayland murder trial

Aunt: Mental illness runs in Nathaniel Fujita's family

Nathaniel Fujita's aunt testified as the first witness for the defense today, saying Fujita had slipped into a deep depression before his ex-girlfriend was killed. (1:49 p.m.)

Victim's mother testifies in Wayland trial

Mary Dunne's voice was ragged on the witness stand as she identified a photo of Lauren Astley, whom she referred to as "my only child." (12:01 p.m.)
  • Pictures Wayland man on trial in murder of ex-girlfriend
  • 2/27 Friend describes frantic search for Lauren Astley
  • 2/26 Bloodstains, wet clothing found at Fujita's home

Mechanical failure at Hull treatment plant sends raw sewage flowing into Atlantic

An estimated 2 million gallons of raw sewage will be pumped into the Atlantic each day the Hull plant is off-line, town and state officials said today. (4:09 p.m.)

Longfellow Bridge work to start this summer

The $255 million project will lead to three years of disruptions, including suspending Red Line service for 25 weekends and eliminating northbound traffic throughout the project.

Marissa Mayer looks like she's trying to out-macho the men who run most of America's boardrooms.

Secretary of State John Kerry's visit to Rome is a chance for him to again see David Thorne, a longtime friend who is also US ambassador to Italy.

The UN's assertion of immunity for peacekeepers after a cholera outbreak might be tragic. But it is absolutely right.
